sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The case of the undertakers for reducing postage of inland letters to just and moderate rates, stated. And therein, the liberty of a commonwealth, the weal of the merchant and industrious trader, and the birthright of every free-man viindicated from monopolizing restraints, and mercenary farming of puplike [sic] offices. Oxenbridge, Clement.
4 p.
s.n., [London : 1653]
Caption title. By Clement Oxenbridge. Cf. Wing (2nd ed.). Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in: Columbia University Library (New York, N.Y.). With: To all ingenuous people: a second intimation fro the new undertakers for conveyance of letters at half the rates ... [London : s.n., 1653].
=======
